meanings.sent1: The rores of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The rores of the engine could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The rores of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: The rores of the metal scraping against the floor echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The rores of the wind howling through the trees created an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The old door rores loudly whenever it's opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate rores whenever it swings back and forth.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to rores by dragging their feet on the gravel path.
meanings.sent4: The car's brakes started to rores as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The branches rores against the window during the storm, keeping me awake all night.

meanings.sent1: The rores of the construction site could be heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The rores of the traffic outside made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The rores of the children playing in the park filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent4: The rores of the argument next door kept me up at night.
meanings.sent5: The rores of the sirens in the distance signaled trouble approaching.
